posts.post_content: I picked up this 1888 N162 of Glascock along with other non-baseball tobacco cards?  I collect federal league items but knew this card had value? Any interest?[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=30213&d=1294070051[/IMG]

Either the back was skinned off, it was rebacked or this was cut from an album page.  If it were the real deal without being rebacked or skinned then it could be worth a few hundred dollars or more (depending upon the condition of the card).  Unfortunately that doesn't have a "normal" back for that card which means it's not worth a few hundred dollars.
I saw those on ebay but didn't bid because of the back/skinning on the baseball card. I will guess it's about a $50-$75 card in that state......but that is a guess. regards

that Robert Sinclair card is for sale?
thanks
